workshop.internal.dao

Class WorkshopEntitiesDaoAbstract<T extends WorkshopEntity,K>

  • java.lang.Object
    • workshop.internal.dao.WorkshopEntitiesDaoAbstract<T,K>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Entity class through setEntityClass(WorkshopEntity.class)
    K - Key class for the Entity class through setKeyClass(Object.class)

    So every subclass must have the explicit NoArgsConstructor as: public EntityDao() { super.setWorkshopEntityClass(Entity.class); super.setKeyClass(Key.class); }

    Subclasses are throw PersistenceContext exceptions

    All Implemented Interfaces:
    WorkshopEntitiesDaoInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthorityPermissionsDao, ClassifiersDao, DepartmentsDao, EmployeesDao, ExternalAuthoritiesDao, InternalAuthoritiesDao, OrdersDao, PhonesDao, PositionsDao, TasksDao, UsersDao, WorkshopEntityTypesDao

    @Repository
public abstract class WorkshopEntitiesDaoAbstract<T extends WorkshopEntity,K>
extends java.lang.Object
implements WorkshopEntitiesDaoInterface
    The class is intended to return Optional.of(WorkshopEntity) either Optional.empty() if nothing found or to throw a java Exceptions to be caught higher. The following parameters are obligatory to be set in the all subclasses:

      • findAllEntities

        public java.util.Optional<java.util.List<T>> findAllEntities(java.lang.Integer pageSize,
                                                             java.lang.Integer pageNum)
                                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                             javax.persistence.PersistenceException
        Spring Page interface starts count pages from 0. Page formula is: (pageNum)*pageSize
        Parameters:
        pageSize - The maximum amount of entities at once (on one page). Min = 0 (will be default = (PAGE_SIZE_DEFAULT) ), Max = PAGE_SIZE_MAX
        pageNum - Starts from 0 (according to Spring Pageable). Number of desired page to be given.
        Returns:
        'Optional.of(List)' sorted by 'created' property in the descending order or 'Optional.empty()' if nothing found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If pageSize < 0 either pageSize > PAGE_SIZE_MAX or pageNum < 0
        javax.persistence.PersistenceException - if the query execution exceeds the query timeout value set and the transaction is rolled back

      • findAllEntities

        public java.util.Optional<java.util.List<T>> findAllEntities(java.lang.Integer pageSize,
                                                             java.lang.Integer pageNum,
                                                             java.lang.String orderBy,
                                                             org.springframework.data.domain.Sort.Direction order)
                                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                             javax.persistence.PersistenceException
        Spring Page interface starts count pages from 0. Page formula is: (pageNum)*pageSize
        Parameters:
        pageSize - The maximum amount of entities at once (on one page). Min = 0, will be Default = (PAGE_SIZE_DEFAULT), Max = PAGE_SIZE_MAX
        pageNum - Starts from 0 (according to Spring Pageable). Number of desired page to be given. Default = 0,
        orderBy - @Nullable. The name of the property to order by. Default = DEFAULT_ORDER_BY
        order - Sort.Direction 'asc' or 'desc' (Ascending or Descending) order. Default = DEFAULT_ORDER
        Returns:
        'Optional>' sorted by property name according to Sort.Direction. If nothing was found Optional.empty() will be returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If pageSize or pageNum are greater or less than their Min and Max values.
        javax.persistence.PersistenceException - If an Entity doesn't have 'orderBy' field name.

      • findByProperty

        public java.util.Optional<java.util.List<T>> findByProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                                            java.lang.String propertyValue)
                                                     throws javax.persistence.PersistenceException,
                                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The search by manually entered Entity.property name and its value. Also accepts ZonedDateTime, LocalDateTime and LocalDate to be parsed if Entity.property instanceof Temporal.class.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The name of the $Object.getClass() and its superclass property. If the propertyName class is matching any instance of ZonedDateTime, LocalDateTime or LocalDate so its 'propertyValue' will be parsed accordingly and may throw the parsing exception.
        propertyValue - The value to be found. It it is the ZonedDateTime, LocalDate value, it is will be parsed accordingly.
        Returns:
        Optional> with the found entities or Optional.ofNullable() if nothing was found.
        Throws:
        javax.persistence.PersistenceException - In case of some DB problems
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If 'propertyName' or 'propertyValue' is either null, or empty, or neither $Object.getClass() or nor of its superclasses don't have such a property, or parsing the 'propertyName' to the instanceof Temporal is failed.

      • persistEntities

        public java.util.Optional<java.util.Collection<T>> persistEntities(java.util.Collection<T> entities)
        Batch insertion into the DataBase. Persists all the given Entities from Collection parameter from 0 to 'batchSize'; every Entity above 'batchSize' in the given Collection have to be returned in the managed state manually. Also clears Hibernate cache (to save memory) so after the batch inserting you have to refresh those entities you need from the batch further.
        Parameters:
        entities - Collection of entities to be batch inserted. It is preferable not to exceed batchSize to be able to get a Collection of persisted and managed Entities.
        Returns:
        If the Collection.size doesn't exceed the batchSize batchSize a collection of copied and managed Entities will be returned. Otherwise the Optional.empty() will be returned (not to overload JPA first-level cache and RAM memory) and you will have to get managed copies of Entities by another way.

      • persistEntity

        public java.util.Optional<T> persistEntity(T entity)
                                    throws javax.persistence.EntityExistsException,
                                           javax.persistence.TransactionRequiredException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                           java.lang.ClassCastException
        Only if an Entity.identifier == 0 or null it will be persisted. If an Entity argument extends Trackable and persisting is performing on behalf of an Employee, Trackable.setCreatedBy() is filling in with an Employee from current SecurityContext. If the persisting is performing on behalf of an User and the Entity argument is instance of Order, so the Order.setCreatedFor() will be filled in by Spring Auditable interface (see SecurityConfiguration). From the SecurityContext we estimate the current Authentication - is this an Employee or User. Employee will be found by email, User by email or phone (both fields can be used as the unique IDs).
        Parameters:
        entity -
        Returns:
        Returns a managed copy of Entity with 'identifier' set
        Throws:
        javax.persistence.EntityExistsException - Throws by the EntityManager itself if such an Entity extsts.
        javax.persistence.TransactionRequiredException - Throws by the EntityManager itself if it is performing not in a transaction
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a given Entity is not an entity either is null or its identifier != 0.
        java.lang.ClassCastException

      • refreshEntities

        public void refreshEntities(java.util.Collection<T> entities)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Works only with managed Entities! Pull any database changes into the managed Entities
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        public void refreshEntity(T entity)

                          javax.persistence.EntityNotFoundException
        Works only with managed Entities! Pull any database changes into the managed Entity
        Throws:
        javax.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if the entity no longer exists in the database.

                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         javax.persistence.TransactionRequiredException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a given entity is null either the instance is not an entity or is a detached entity
        javax.persistence.TransactionRequiredException - This method has to be performed within a Transaction.

      • sortEntitiesResultList

        void sortEntitiesResultList(java.util.List<T> resultListToSort,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.String orderBy,
                            @Nullable
                            org.springframework.data.domain.Sort.Direction order)
        Sorts the given List of WorkshopEntities by reference (that is just change the given List order without a returning a new one).
        Parameters:
        resultListToSort - The List of Entities to be sorted.
        orderBy - @Nullable. Property name to be sorted by. If null, DEFAULT_ORDER_BY will be used.
        order - @Nullable. Ascending or Descending. If null, DEFAULT_ORDER will be used.

      • verifyPageableValues

        void verifyPageableValues(int pageSize,
                          int pageNum)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        pageSize - PageSize to be verified according to PAGE_SIZE_MAX or being below zero.
        pageNum - PageNumber to be verified if its below zero
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If pageSize or pageNum are greater or less than their Min and Max values or < 0.

      • verifyPageableValues

        void verifyPageableValues(int pageSize,
                          int pageNum,
                          java.lang.String orderBy,
                          org.springframework.data.domain.Sort.Direction order)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        pageSize - PageSize to be verified according to PAGE_SIZE_MAX
        pageNum - PageNumber to be verified
        orderBy - To be verified for null and isEmpty().
        order - To be verified for null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - 1) If pageSize or pageNum are greater or less than their Min and Max values or < 0. 2) If 'orderBy' is null or empty 3) If 'order' is null
